Guide.title: WhatsApp instructions for use
Guide.Content: How to cancel a WhatsApp message, how to retrieve your deleted WhatsApp messages or how to share your location via WhatsApp? In this ultimate NextPit guide, we share with you all our tips and tricks to use WhatsApp well and optimize your experience.

Guide.title: How to listen to your WhatsApp messages discreetly
Guide.Content: When you listen to a voice message, it is played through your main speaker, allowing those around you to enjoy the content. That said, a simple solution exists: simply bring the phone closer to your ear during playback and the proximity sensor will understand that you are holding it nearby, so it will automatically switch the sound to the other speaker, used for calls.

Guide.title: How to cancel the sending of a WhatsApp voice message
Guide.Content: When you send a voice message, you must keep pressing the recording button. When you stop pressing, the message is sent. That said, you can cancel the message you are dictating by swiping your finger to the left of the input field, a small trash can then appears, indicating that your message is deleted.

Guide.title: How to mark a WhatsApp message as a favorite
Guide.Content: If you are an intensive WhatsApp user, you write and receive a lot of messages. For one reason or another, you may want to make some available more easily than others: just bookmark them. Go to the conversation and press and hold the message you want to bookmark, then click on the star in the new menu at the top. To access favorite messages, go to WhatsApp's main window and click on the three vertical dots. Then enter the 'Important Messages' tab and you will find your favorites.

Guide.title: How to do a WhatsApp search for contacts or messages
Guide.Content: Do you have a lot of contacts and are you looking for someone in particular? Nothing could be simpler: simply click on the magnifying glass and type the name of the person you are looking for. The search is not limited to finding contacts. If you have a long conversation with a contact, and you want to find a particular message, you can also easily access it. Enter the conversation and then click on the three dots at the top right, then click on Search and voila.

Guide.title: How to send a file to a contact on WhatsApp
Guide.Content: Just follow the same procedure as explained above, except that this time in the paper clip you must choose 'Document'. You will then access your internal memory (or Drive files), select the file you want to send and validate.

Guide.title: How to send your location or contact number on WhatsApp
Guide.Content: In certain circumstances, you may need to send your exact location or send another contact's phone number. To do this, simply go to the conversation window with your interlocutor and then click on the paper clip at the top right. You will find the different sending positions. To send your location, simply click on 'Location' and in the next window, choose the option that best suits what you want to do. To send a contact, simply select 'Contact' in the paper clip, choose one from the list and validate with the arrow at the bottom.

Guide.title: How to be sure to have the latest version of WhatsApp
Guide.Content: In general, the Play Store warns you when one of your applications can be updated. Of course, you can check if a version is available by going to the Play Store, by clicking on the menu on the left you will find 'my applications' and will be able to see which ones can be updated. If you do not want to wait for the update to be made available in the Play Store, you can pick up the APK file and install it manually. We explain everything to you in this article. If you want to discover what's new in WhatsApp in preview, we advise you to opt for WhatsApp beta.

Guide.title: How to make an audio or video call on WhatsApp
Guide.Content: Nothing could be simpler. Enter the conversation window, you will find at the top right the symbol of a phone, next to the paper clip. Tap it, the application will then ask you if you want to make an audio or video call. Select the desired function and the call will be launched.

Guide.title: How to change your WhatsApp status?
Guide.Content: Just click on the 3 vertical dots at the top right. On the menu, click Status. You can then change it as you wish by clicking on the small brush to the right of the existing status, or by choosing one of the default statuses below.

Guide.title: How to delete photos and videos sent on WhatsApp
Guide.Content: WhatsApp can sometimes be annoying because every time you send an image/video it is saved in your phone in the directory of files sent. For example, you took a photo today in town and want to send it to someone, the photo will then be found not only in your camera folder but also in that of your WhatsApp conversation with that contact. You can go to the directory where they are saved and delete them manually: go to the WhatsApp directory of your internal memory then enter Media and enter what you want to delete, then to the 'Send' folder (sent) and delete.

Guide.title: How to disable automatic loading of media files on WhatsApp
Guide.Content: When you receive a lot of photos on WhatsApp, you don't always want them to be downloaded by default. Not only are they not always interesting but above all their download consumes data. Rest assured, you can disable automatic download, you will then have to validate the download manually.

Guide.title: How do I know if someone blocked you on WhatsApp?
Guide.Content: There is no miracle solution to be sure that a contact has blocked you but certain elements can help you understand it. First, check if the last connection date is visible below his name, in the conversation window. Then check if the messages sent are sent: you should see two notches instead of one. You can also see if it is possible to invite the person to a group, if they blocked you it should be impossible. Finally, check if you can see your contact's photo, if he blocked you you can no longer access his profile. All this is to be taken with tweezers since users may hide the date of the last connection and/or not have a profile picture.

Guide.title: How to block a WhatsApp user?
Guide.Content: It's very simple. Open the conversation with this contact, press the menu key and select Block. The list of blocked contacts can be found in Settings > My Account > Privacy.

Guide.title: How to send messages with Google Now/Google Assistant on WhatsApp
Guide.Content: If for any reason you do not want to use your hands/fingeres, know that you can go through Google Now to send a WhatsApp message entirely via voice interface. Simply launch it manually or say 'OK Google' (if this option is enabled), then say 'sending #message to #contact on WhatsApp'. For example, 'sending hello to Carole on WhatsApp'. The application then asks you to confirm, you can either press the arrow or confirm vocally.
